content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are moderately cautious and may take risks but generally prefer to avoid them. You like to have some degree of security and predictability. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 35$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 35$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 40$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

Given my preference for some degree of security and predictability, I would choose to minimize losses and maximize potential gains within the constraints of this game. In each round, if I pick R, I risk losing money (when they pick B) but have a higher potential payoff (if they also pick R). However, there's a higher chance that my opponent will pick B since it offers them a higher reward for choosing differently from me.

On the other hand, if I consistently choose B, I minimize my losses and have a guaranteed higher average return in instances where my opponent chooses R (since I still earn 35$). With 75 rounds, I expect that my opponent will pick R less often than B, resulting in more gains for me when they do.

Given this reasoning, I would choose to play B {B} in most or all rounds of the game.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 40$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

In the next round, I will again choose B because my strategy involves minimizing losses and maximizing potential gains while ensuring a degree of predictability. Since both me and my opponent chose B in the previous round, we both earned 40$.

By consistently choosing B, I am aiming to have more favorable outcomes when my opponent does decide to choose R, which will likely happen less frequently due to the higher payout they receive for doing so. This strategy should help me minimize losses and maximize potential gains over the long run. So, in this round, I will again choose B {B}.
